chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: ECL Watch provides an interface to the HPCC system and allows you to view information and interrogate nodes to confirm all expected processes are running. This provides a simple centric view into the system and a means to perform Work Unit and data files maintenance.***

chapter.title: Clusters
chapter.para: Displays activity on all clusters in an environment. From this list, you can select one and perform Preflight activities.***
You also have hyperlink access to the current log files.***

sect1.title: Activity
sect1.para: The Activity menu provides access to THOR Job Queue Administration tasks.*** It displays activity on all clusters in the environment. From this view, you can see the progress of jobs and set the priority of queued jobs.***

sect2.title: Activity on Servers***
sect2.para: Click on the Activity hyperlink below Clusters in the menu on the left. This will take you to the Existing Activity on Servers Page.***
Clicking on the icon next to a cluster (or rt-clicking on the appropriate link next to the specific cluster) provides the following menu options***

sect3.title: Pause
sect3.para: Pauses the cluster’s job queue. The currently running job will complete, but no other jobs will execute until the queue is resumed.***

sect3.title: Resume
sect3.para: Resumes the cluster’s job queue. Jobs will resume execution in order.***

sect3.title: Clear
sect3.para: Removes all workunits from the job queue. The state of removed workunits is set to aborted. Any workunits that were waiting in the queue can be resubmitted manually later.***

sect3.title: Usage
sect3.para: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.

sect2.title: Workunit options***
sect2.para: Clicking on the icon next to a running Workunit (or rt-clicking on the hyperlink) provides this menu option***

sect2.title: Queued Workunit options***
sect2.para: Clicking on the icon next to a queued (blocked) Workunit (or rt-clicking on the hyperlink) provides the following menu options***

sect3.title: Move Up
sect3.para: Moves the job (Workunit) up one position in the queue.

sect3.title: Move Down
sect3.para: Moves the job (Workunit) down one position in the queue.

sect3.title: Move Top
sect3.para: Moves the job (Workunit) to the top position in the queue.

sect3.title: Move Bottom
sect3.para: Moves the job (Workunit) to the last position in the queue.

sect3.title: Remove
sect3.para: Removes the Workunit from the queue and sets it state to aborted. The Workunit can be resubmitted manually later.

sect1.title: Scheduler
sect1.para: Provides an interface to the ECL Event Scheduler. Displays scheduled workunits and allows you to post an event.***

sect2.title: Push Event

chapter.title: ECL Workunits
chapter.para: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.

sect1.title: Search
sect1.para: Allows you to search for workunits by WUID, Username, Cluster, State, ECL text, Job Name, Logical File, or date. You can also specify whether to search active or archived workunits.***

listitem.para: Click on the Search hyperlink below ECL Workunitsin the menu on the left.
The ECL Search Workunits page appears:

sect2.title: Open WUID
sect2.para: Provide the WUID and press the Open button. ***
The Workunit Information page displays (if the WU is found)***

sect2.title: Search Workunits
sect2.para: Provide the search criteria, then press the Find button.***
The list of workunits meeting that search criteria then displays.***

sect1.title: Browse
sect1.para: Displays all active workunits. From this view, you can also filter by Owner, state, or cluster.***

listitem.para: Click on the Browse hyperlink below ECL Workunitsin the menu on the left.
The ECL Workunits page appears:

To filter by an Owner, click on a hyperlink of the Owner whose workunits you wish to see. To filter by a Cluster, click on a hyperlink of the Cluster whose workunits you wish to see. To filter by a State, click on a hyperlink of the State of workunits you wish to see.***

This page also allows you to select workunits (using the checkboxes to the left) and using the buttons at the bottom of the page, perform one of the following actions to all selected workunits: Delete, Protect, Unprotect, Reschedule, Deschedule, or Set to Failed. ***

row.entry: If a workunit is Protected, the delete action is not available.

sect2.title: Open WUID
sect2.para: Click on a Workunit’s hyperlink to display the Workunit information page.***
The resulting web page provides detail about the Work Unit.***
Click on a button to expand a section. Click on a button to collapse a section.

WUID
This link provides a view of the actual xml representation of the query/workunits.***
Action
Displays the Action to be performed***
State
Displays the current WU State
Owner
Displays the job’s owner.
Scope
Displays the job’s scope. You can add or change a job scope using this field.
Jobname
Displays the Job Name. You can add or change a job name using this field.
Description
Displays the Job Description. You can add or change it using this field.
Protected
When checked, protects the Workunit from deletion.
Cluster
Displays the cluster used
Warnings
Displays compiler warnings.
Info
Displays any relevant Workunit info***
Results
Displays links to the job’s result(s).
Files
Displays files used by the query.
Graphs
Selecting this link provides a graphical representation of work unit’s execution graphs and their progress.
Timings
Displays timings for portions of the job’s execution.
Query
Displays the ECL code submitted.
Helpers
Provides links to the CPP file or DLL file.
The buttons at the bottom of the page allow you Save, Reset, Abort, Delete, Resubmit, or Recompile the Workunit. If a workunit is archived, a Restore button displays allowing you to restore it to the active workunit store.***

sect3.title: Workunit Details
sect3.para: Page provides specific information about the Workunit***

sect1.title: Browse
sect1.para: The Browse hyperlink below Query Sets menu on the left hand side, provides access to the Querysets page. The Querysets page allows Queries to the Cluster Processes***

sect2.title: thor Queryset***
sect2.para: Clicking on the thor link from the QuerySets page displays the thor Queryset page. From this page you can get more information about the specific thor queries. ***

thor Queryset
Click on the link name of the query set to select it, and from the buttons on the page you can Delete or Toggle Suspend the queryset.***
Click on the Aliases tab to get Alias information about the queryset.***

sect2.title: myroxie Queryset***
sect2.para: Clicking on the myroxie link from the QuerySets page displays the myroxie Queryset page. From this page you can get more information about the specific roxie queries. ***
Click on the link name of the query set to select it, and from the buttons on the page you can Delete or Toggle Suspend the queryset.***
Click on the Aliases tab to get Alias information about the queryset.***

chapter.title: Topology
chapter.para: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.

sect1.title: Target Clusters
sect1.para: Displays all clusters in an environment. From this list, you can select one and perform Preflight activities. You also have hyperlink access to the current log files.*** Target Clusters

sect1.title: Cluster Processes
sect1.para: Displays all clusters in an environment. From this list, you can select one and perform Preflight activities. You also have hyperlink access to the current log files.*** Clusters

sect1.title: System Servers
sect1.para: Displays all supporting servers in an environment. From this list, you can select one or more and perform Preflight activities. You also have hyperlink access to the current log files.***

The System Server page provides useful infomation on the system’s configuration including Queue names, Server name, IP Address and Port, and installation directory. In addition, clicking on the icon next to a component's directory, displays that component's configuration file. This file can be useful in troubleshooting deployment settings.

The Logical Files page displays showing all files with logical entries in the Dali Server’s Distributed File System.
From this page, you can despray or copy any file.

Check this box to create backup copies of all file parts exist in the backup directory (by convention on the secondary drive of the node following in the cluster).
Check this box to compress the files.

sect1.title: Remote Copy
sect1.para: Remote Copy allows you to copy data from a Thor cluster outside your environment to the one in your environment.

listitem.para: Click on the Remote Copy hyperlink below DFU in the menu on the left.
The Copy File page displays.
Fill in Source, Destination, and Options information.

row.entry: The logical file name in the remote environment.
The Dali Server in the remote environment
A valid user in the remote environment
The password for the user in the remote environment
Select the name of THOR cluster to copy to.
You can only choose from THOR clusters within the current environment.
The logical name for the copied file.
Check this box to create backup copies of all file parts exist in the backup directory (by convention on the d: drive of the node following in the cluster).
Check this box to keep the number of parts the same and wrap if the target cluster is smaller that the original.
Check this box to overwrite files of the same name.
Check this box to compress the files.
Check this box to retain the superfile structure.

listitem.para: Press the Submit button.
The DFU Workunit displays.
Press the Refresh button periodically until the status of your request indicates it is Finished or click on the View Progress hyperlink to see a progress indicator.

sect1.title: XRef
sect1.para: The XREF utility provides the ability to find “orphaned” and “lost and found” files. These “orphan” are files which are found on the nodes but not registered in the Distributed File System.

XRef Clusters
Found File
A found file has partial file parts on disk that are not referenced in the Dali server. All the file parts are accounted for so they can be added back to the Dali server. They can also be deleted from the cluster, if required.
Orphan File
An orphan file has partial file parts on disk. However, a full set of parts is not available to construct a complete logical file. These partial file parts, therefore, do not have a reference in the Dali server.
Lost File
A logical file that is missing at least one file part on both the primary and replicated locations in storage. The logical file is still referenced in the Dali server. Deleting the file removes the reference from the Dali server and any remaining parts on disk.
To generate a list:

>>Press the Generate button.
Sasha Server typically runs Xref at the times scheduled when deployed.
To view results:

listitem.para: Click on one of the hyperlinks (Found Files, Orphan Files, Lost Files, Directories, or Errors/Warnings).

sect2.title: Working with XREF results:
sect2.para: Orphan and Lost files are difficult to recover, unless you have copies of missing parts needed to reconstruct the file (for example, if a missing part is on a hard drive that was replaced.) Typically, these files are deleted.
Check the boxes next to files you want to delete, then press the Delete button.
Found files can and usually are reattached.
Check he boxes next to files you want to reattach, then press the Attach button.

chapter.title: Users/Permissions
chapter.para: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.
Users/Permission options only available in the Enterprise Edition.***

sect1.title: Users
sect1.para: ECL Watch provides access to User Administration in the Enterprise Edition.***
Click on the Users hyperlink below Users/Permissions in the menu on the left side.
The Users page displays.

Users Page
Click on the Edit hyperlink next to a name to edit any user information.
Click on the Password hyperlink next to a name to change a password.
Press the Add button at the bottom of the page to create a new user.
Select one or more users to enable the export button. Pressing the export button will export the selected users to an excel spreadsheet.

sect1.title: Groups
sect1.para: Click on the Groups hyperlink below Users/Permissions in the menu on the left side. Available on the Enterprise Edition.***
The Groups page displays.
Click on the members hyperlink next to a group to see the members of that group.
Click on the Permissions hyperlink next to a group to see the permissions associated with that group.
Select one or more groups to enable the export button. Pressing the export button will export the selected groups to an excel spreadsheet.

sect1.title: Permissions
sect1.para: Editing Permissions using ECL Watch. Available in the Enterprise Edition.***
Open the ECL Watch home page in Internet Explorer.
The URL is the IP address of your ESP Server plus the port to which the WS-SMC Service is bound. For example:
The ECL Watch home page displays.
Click on the Permissions hyperlink below Users/Permissions in the menu on the left side.
The Permissions page displays.
Click on the Edit hyperlink for access to edit permissions.
A page listing items for the selected feature displays.
Click on the Permissions hyperlink to set permissions for users or groups.

sect2.title: Feature Permission
sect2.para: This section describes access control to features of the HPCC system. In this area you control access to functionality within ECL Watch.

row.entry: LDAP Path
Description
Access

entry.para: Access to Create, Delete, Update, Submit, and Abort DFU Wus
Make changes and generate XREF Reports
Access to Remote Execution in ECL Watch
Access to Spraying and Copying files
Access to read files in Drop zone
Access to write to files in Drop zone
Access to SNMP Metrics Information (Roxie Metrics)
Access to View Other User's Workunits
Access to Modify or Resubmit User's Workunits
Access to Delete Other User's Workunits
Access to Create or Modify Own Workunit
Access to Thor Job Queue Control
